course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Advance Display Technologies
course.description: Introduction of the human visual system, Colorimetry and photometry, Introduction of the modern TFTs, Modern AMLCD, AMOLED, Fluorescence and phosphorescence, Introduction of Electrophoretic displays, Color electrophoretic displays, Nano-material for displays, Electroluminescence and Photoluminescence, Quantum dot, Quantum rods, State-of-the-art development in the area of display technology: High-resolution displays (4k, 8k, and 10k), Local backlight dimming, Introduction to AR/VR display solutions, Holographic displays, Flexible displays etc.

reviews.author: Chingyu1
reviews.title: Average workload
reviews.comment_content:
Display technologies

Chapter 1.    Display Introduction (1)
Chapter 2.           Introduction of TFTs (1)
Chapter 3.          AMLCD (3)
Chapter 4.          AMOLED displays, (2)
Chapter 5.           Electrophoretic displays, (2)
Chapter 6.          Nano-material for displays, (2)
Chapter 7.    Recent developments in the display technology, (2)
reviews.comment_teaching: Teach quite fast and discuss a lot of stuff but homework is usually related to books (especially published by faculties of HKUST). The lecture is at night so may get tired.
reviews.comment_grading:
Depends mostly on midterm and project presentation

Homework 30% (x4)
Midterm 30% (opennotes)
Project presentation 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
Not high, complete all homework and revise for midterm would be fine.
For midterm having the powerpoint in hand is sufficient
